bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext: This version adds -v and -P which are both extremely useful.

Martin, if you enable release monitoring and register the package upstream in Anitya on <https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/sshpass/>, you will receive bug reports about new releases automatically.
If I can be of help let me know.
sshpass-1.06-1.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-594c2b4f81
I went ahead and built this update for rawhide and f25.
Could this also get rebuild for F24?
sshpass-1.06-1.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2e27df9a26
sshpass-1.06-1.el7 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 7. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-04f51458d8
sshpass-1.06-1.el6 has been submitted as an update to Fedora EPEL 6. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-EPEL-2017-00c00b37ef

(In reply to Petr Pisar from comment #1) > Martin, if you enable release monitoring and register the package upstream > in Anitya on <https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/sshpass/>, > you will receive bug reports about new releases automatically.
Just did that. Thanks, Petr.
Note for myself: the rpmlint's incorrect-fsf-address error discussed within BZ#732651.

sshpass-1.06-1.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-2e27df9a26

(In reply to Martin Cermak from comment #9) > (In reply to Petr Pisar from comment #1) > > Martin, if you enable release monitoring and register the package upstream > > in Anitya on <https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/sshpass/>, > > you will receive bug reports about new releases automatically. > > Just did that. Thanks, Petr.
You only registered the package in Anitya. You still need to enable the monitoring in the Fedora package database <https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/sshpass/>.

(In reply to Petr Pisar from comment #15)
Enabled that just now, thanks.
